sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: This article is a peek behind the curtain of how content is managed here at Smashing Magazine. In it, you’ll get a tour of an article’s full lifecycle, from a basic outline to the sort of thing you’re reading right this second.
articles.title: How Smashing Magazine Uses TinaCMS To Manage An Editorial Workflow

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Let’s play with images and experiment with CSS masks. The idea is fairly simple: take a single `` tag and harness the power of CSS to accomplish complex hover transitions. Through different demos, you will see how CSS masks combined with gradients allow us to create fancy effects — with efficient, reusable code.
articles.title: Revealing Images With CSS Mask Animations

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ben Shih)
articles.description: Running a workshop can be an effective alternative to traditional, long-standing meetings. To help ensure its success, Ben Shih introduces the concept of an inclusive workshop. In Part 1 of the series, you discover the fundamentals of inclusivity and get some solid guidance on how to plan an inclusive remote workshop.
articles.title: Facilitating Inclusive Online Workshops (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Samathanam)
articles.description: Gradients are a powerful CSS feature. We use them for texture, depth, and even to hide parts of elements with CSS masking. This article covers another interesting way to use gradients — as a hover effect that affects the appearance of other elements around the hovered element.
articles.title: Gradients, Blend Modes, And A Really Cool Hover Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: Pratik Joglekar takes a philosophical approach to remind designers about the lost joy within themselves by effectively placing massive importance on mindfulness, introspection, and forward-looking. Without joy, the work we do would feel meaningless. To prevent it from happening, check out a few ideas that would help rediscover that spark of joy.
articles.title: Rediscovering The Joy Of Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: Is the Test Pyramid really dead? Discover the more contemporary testing strategies and evaluate the Test Pyramid’s relevance in today’s software development practices.
articles.title: Long Live The Test Pyramid

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: In this article, Joas Pambou builds the tool to provide a sentiment score in **real-time** with enhanced user experience by providing multilingual support. You will use an OpenAI library called Whisper that transcribes audio files into text and detects the language, and Gradio, a UI framework, to establish the interface.
articles.title: Generating Real-Time Audio Sentiment Analysis With AI

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s get ready for September with some fresh wallpaper designs! Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this collection come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: A September Of Never Ending Adventures (2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: The CSS Color Module Level 4 specification defined a slew of new color features when it became a candidate recommendation in 2022, including Oklab and Oklch, which have widened the field of color we have to work with. Explore the Oklch color space and how to start using it in CSS today.
articles.title: Falling For Oklch: A Love Story Of Color Spaces, Gamuts, And CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: The so-called “Double Diamond” is a great way of visualizing an ideal design process — but it’s just not the way most companies deliver new projects or services. Andy Budd proposes a new “Double Diamond” idea that better aligns with the way work actually gets done and highlights the place where design has the most leverage.
articles.title: Improving The Double Diamond Design Process

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: We often think of shadows in CSS as something to reach for when we want to add depth to a design. But shadows can be used for more than depth. Let’s experiment with different shadows — two CSS properties and a filter — to make interesting hover effects, different text styles, and even casting shadows on other shadows.
articles.title: A Few Interesting Ways To Use CSS Shadows For More Than Depth

articles.author: Musab Habeeb
articles.description: Before Node.js came into existence,  JavaScript could only be run on the browser. It could only be used as a scripting language for frontend web development.  Then, Node.js came to free JavaScript from this confinement. It made JavaScript ubiquitous (meaning it could now be run everywhere). Node.js is a
articles.title: JavaScript Concepts to Know Before Learning Node.js

articles.author: Destiny Erhabor
articles.description: Serverless computing has revolutionized the way developers build and deploy applications in the cloud. It takes away the complexities of server management, allowing developers to focus solely on writing code and delivering value to their users. In the realm of serverless computing, AWS Lambda stands out as a leading platform
articles.title: How to Deploy an AWS Lambda Function with Serverless Framework

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: It is easier than ever to launch your own Software as a Service (SaaS) company! (The hard part is getting people interested in it). We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will guide you through every step of building and deploying a full-stack AI SaaS application.
articles.title: Build and Deploy an AI SaaS with Paid Subscriptions

articles.author: Jose Vicente Nunez
articles.description: I was tasked recently to find which of our processes was accessing a NFS share [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_File_System]. During this process, I found that some tools are better adapted than others for the task. In this article, I want to share with you my findings. The whole process was fun and gave
articles.title: Network File System – How to Confirm Your Application is Using NFS

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: Today I'm joined by Eric Leung, Data Scientist at Disney and long-time open source contributor to freeCodeCamp. Eric Leung grew up in Oklahoma and learned a lot of math in high school. His friends wanted to go to medical school and he originally planned to join them. But instead
articles.title: Podcast: Disney Data Scientist Eric Leung on Math, Medicine, and Learning to Code

articles.author: Tom Mondloch
articles.description: The Solana Curriculum is live. You can now learn Solana's blockchain protocol and the Solana tool ecosystem interactively by building a series of projects. This curriculum is made possible by The Solana Foundation, who gave our charity a grant to 100% fund development of this curriculum. What will this curriculum
articles.title: Introducing the Solana Curriculum: Smart Contracts, dApps, and Command Line Tools

articles.author: Nishant Kumar
articles.description: A wise man once told me, "When you start eating Bun, Node.js will feel bland". But why is that relevant? JavaScript got way faster with a new JavaScript runtime called Bun, which is now production-ready with its version 1.0 release. But how and why is it faster than Node.js? A
articles.title: A Quick Look at Bun 1.0 – The Node.js Alternative

articles.author: Ayu Adiati
articles.description: I've contributed to open-source projects for a few years and learned a lot from the process. These experiences allowed me to look closer at the open source flow, from the technical, such as Git and GitHub, to the non-technical aspects. Although they are as important as the technical sides, the
articles.title: How to Contribute to Open Source Projects – Non-Technical Things You Should Know

articles.author: David A. Kra
articles.description: Usually a Python function passes its results back using a return statement. The problem is that sometimes it can't, so you need to figure out a different way to return those results.  This happens, most often, when someone else's library's interface is in the way, and you can't change
articles.title: How to Return Results from a Python Function to Your Program When a Library is Blocking the Way

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Vector embeddings are a key concept in the realm of machine learning and artificial intelligence. They bridge the gap between human language and machine understanding. We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach out about vector embeddings and how to create an AI assistant. Ania
articles.title: Use Vector Embeddings to Create an AI Assistant

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Dynamic programming is a powerful technique that has been a cornerstone in the world of algorithms and computer science. It's a method that breaks down problems into smaller, more manageable sub-problems, solving each one only once and storing their solutions in case they're needed again. This approach is particularly useful
articles.title: Learn Dynamic Programming Techniques in Java

articles.author: Seth Falco
articles.description: On the modern web, we've normalized fetching fonts from client-side, or embedding fonts in resources that are served to users. While this may be tempting, it actually makes very little sense for most use-cases. This isn't suggesting to never use external fonts. Just a reminder that fonts aren't free, and
articles.title: Things to Consider When Picking Fonts for your Next Project – An In-Depth Guide

articles.author: Eivind Kjosbakken
articles.description: The Donut model in Python is a model you can use to extract text from a given image. This can be useful in various scenarios, like scanning receipts, for example.  You can easily download the Donut model from GitHub [https://github.com/clovaai/donut]. But as is common with AI models, you should
articles.title: How to Fine-Tune the Donut Model – With Example Use Case

articles.author: Manish Shivanandhan
articles.description: In 2023, the digital landscape is filled with unprecedented cybersecurity risks. From phishing scams to ransomware attacks. This article outlines different types of cyber attacks that individuals and businesses should be vigilant about. Cyber-attacks are a prevalent threat in the online world. They have the potential to cause substantial difficulties
articles.title: 13 Types of Cyber Attacks You Should Know in 2023

articles.description: When you’re building the backend of an application, you’ve got to figure out how all the different components are going to talk to each other.  It’s like setting up a communication network for your app’s brain, and the way you do it can seriously impact how well your app

We just posted a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that
articles.title: Fundamentals of Finance & Economics for Businesses

articles.description: Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) is a highly scalable, durable, and available object storage service. It is designed to store any amount of data, anytime, from anywhere on the web.  S3 is a key component of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud platform. AWS Lambda is a serverless computing
articles.title: How to Read a CSV File from S3 Bucket in AWS Lambda - A Definitive Guide

articles.description: CSS transitions and animations provide smooth, gradual ways to change an element's style. But they work in different ways. articles.description: String concatenation is a common task that we do often. String concatenation is the operation of joining character strings end-to-end. articles.title: How JavaScript String Concatenation Works – the "+" Operator vs the "+=" Operator

articles.title: How to Remove Empty Rows and Columns in Google Sheets

articles.title: How to Contribute to Open-Source Projects – A Handbook for Beginners

articles.title: Signal Processing and Systems in Programming – Guide for Beginners

articles.title: How to Use Azure Kubernetes Service for Container Orchestration

articles.title: How to Build a Linear Regression Model – Machine Learning Example

articles.description: TDD, or Test-Driven Development, is a software development approach where tests are written before the actual code is implemented. articles.title: Test Driven Development in Android Apps – A Practical Guide to TDD

articles.author: Destiny Erhabor
articles.description: Linux is an open-source operating system that is widely used in various applications due to its flexibility, stability, and security. One of the fundamental aspects of Linux is user management, which enables administrators to control access to resources and maintain security of the system. In the fast-paced world of technology,
articles.title: How to Manage Users in Linux

articles.title: Accessibility Resources for Developers

articles.title: How to Use React Components – Props, Default Props, and PropTypes Explained

articles.title: How to Use AI-Generated Code in a Safe and Effective Way
